Reviews.Title: “good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dabullar
Reviews.Content: This is a very decent spot to stay near the Leidsplein in Amsterdam. There are lots of nearby restaurants and bars, short walk to the tram, and not a bad walk from Central Station. The reception staff spoke good English. WiFi was an effort because you had to sign in with username and password anytime you had been off for 15 minutes. Breakfast was very good. It was served to you at your table (not a buffet) but consisted of the typical Dutch breakfast elements. However, if you were in a hurry, there was no real way to speed up the process. There was no good view from our room, but things were quiet. Our room was much bigger than the standard Amsterdam hotel so it was nice to be able to spread out a bit. The hot water was fine, and good pressure, but the control knob for the shower was very difficult to adjust correctly.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great....”
Reviews.Author: Rob C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Freeland in Amsterdam for 6 nights, march12 - march19. It was one of the nicest all around travel experience I ever had. When we arrived, we were warmly greeted by Pascale and were offered breakfast while our room was being cleaned. We had a complimentary breakfast consisting of of eggs, toast, cold meats, cheeses, juice and all kinds of jams and butters for the toast. Also, Bart (super friendly) makes some dam-good coffee and the cafe was downstairs from the lobby and was very nice. This was the first time I was really able to relax since we arrived. We left our bags and took about an hour walk, came back and was greeted by Mo (forgive me for my incorrect spelling), who was also super friendly and gave us the rundown by map on where to go, what to see, hot to get around and how to access the security door to enter the hotel. We felt very safe and secure. Tram's are everywhere and run constantly, very easy to get around. Our room was ready and we were very pleased. We stayed in room #5, above the lobby, and it had a huge bathroom, great shower, toilet, double sinks, 1 double bed, 1 single bed, 4 chairs a table, coffeemaker, tv, closet with drawers, balcony and was clean. Our linens and towels were all fresh washed and the balcony overlooked the street down to Leidseplein square, which was an awesome location. The room was cleaned regularly and provided fresh towels. We would stay here again for sure. Not only was Amsterdam one of the best places we ever visited but, the Hotel Freeland played a big part of how good our trip was. Friendly, clean and professional is how I would describe Hotel Freeland and when we return, it will be the place we stay. Thanks a lot. R&K :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Londonsiouxsie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for just one night and was glad as i was on ground floor as i had very bulky luggage and the narrow stairs could have been a challenge. My single room was small but clean & fresh and the bed was comfortable if very narrow with a single duvet. Watch out for the tiny ( tiny !!) step in the toilet as I stubbed my toe every time I went to the loo. My room was very quiet despite being adjacent to the shared toilet. It has a great central location with a 2 mins walk to Leidesplein. Breakfast was more than adequate with eggs, meat, cheese and toast. There is a gorgeous huge cat which was a major plus for me. The shower was also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Christie A
Reviews.Content: Great location. 2 minutes away from tram station and Leidseplein. I stayed in the second floor. Absolutely no noise. The staff is very polite and friendly. Breakfast is good. The rooms were spacious and clean. They changed towels daily. If I ever come back to Amsterdam I will stay there again..for sure! PS The cat needs a diet!

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: M E Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: -EASY TO FIND, good location,tram is 3 min walk, centreal 15 min walk, pubs restaurants disco 3 min hotel -great welcome and information from staff -clean everywhere, towels, bedsheets and bathroom clean and smell fresh -room well spaced, good facilities, curtains are well sized and keep the light out - breakfast service very friendly, good portions -parking near by but hotel can advise cheap parkin too, ask them -HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL -GREAT VALUE -WOULD GO BACK MYSELF

Reviews.Title: “My short stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah F Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It was clean, the staff were extremely friendly and the room was very large for what we paid. One thing was staying on the top floor - that it was pretty high up but other than that I loved it here. It wasn't too loud even though there are a couple of pubs across the street. The continental breakfast included was just enough - and I loved the cat!!! This hotel is well worth the money - the location is great too (except I walked the extremely long way around to get to this hotel haha!) Overall FOUR ****'s!I would definitely stay here again. xxx Thankyou xxx

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff, good value accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: maseofbase
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two girlfriends in early Feb 2012 for 3 nights. We arrived very late in the evening (after managing to get on the wrong train in the opposite direction from the airport), the guy on reception was a bit frosty at first and told us we should have called as reception was closed but after our rather pathetic excuse he got a bit more cheerful and showed us to our room! The room itself was a decent size, a double and single bed (was room number 5 on first floor), we had explicitly asked for a quieter room as had seen on trip advisor that the front rooms can be noisy as the tram passes outside the front of the hotel and there are a couple of lively bars across the road! The room was indeed quiet, with a large window, large shower room that was fairly powerful and always had hot water! Very comfy beds as well! A huge radiator which we could turn up and down as we wished. Lovely warm room. The only noise we experienced which was a bit frustrating was from the 3 16year old boys who were staying in the room above us who sounded like they were throwing the furniture around at times! But there's not much the staff could have done about that! Breakfast was cheerful and definitely set us up for our days wanderings. Loads of toast, boiled egg, hams and cheeses as well as a range of spreads. The location was fab. Round the corner from the Leidesplein tram stop and walkable distance from everywhere really! It was freezing while we were there yet we still managed the walks in minus temps! We found the staff to be extremely kind, friendly and helpful. They gave us suggestions of where to go, what cafes we should visit and directions! It really helped having free internet on their computer as well to suss things out and pre plan our days. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at Freeland and I would definitetly consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Great Staff, Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ShaiDarek
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for two nights. The overall experiance is very good. The only negative thing I can say is the facilities are not in their best conditions but it's not too bad... On the other hand the hotel staff are wonderful, very kind and helpful. They put every efforts to make my stay in the hotel pleasant. Great thanks to Jason the receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Leidseplein Jewel”
Reviews.Author: daver49
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff and clean. I travel to Amsterdam often and you will be hard pressed to find a better hotel for the money

Reviews.Title: “Love it.”
Reviews.Author: Dawn D
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and Manual and Pascale...you rock. Everyone else too but didn't get all names! And isn't this awful, the wonderful man who more often than not served us a wonderful breakfast...I never got your name but love your sense of humor when I mentioned the coffee and the spoon standing up joke. I arrived early so Pascale stashed my pack. Coffee and tea are offered like you have dropped into a neighbors house. "You want a tea?" ( Remembered I don't drink coffee) They shuffle in in the morning like regular people in jeans and sweatshirts. Man, it was great. Our room was small but had a lovely little sun room - threw all the big bags in there and we were good. If you go to Amsterdam to sit in your room all day then this is not the place for you. If you go to see the sights and something other than lounge, then this is it. It is where you want to be and you WILL NOT find more helpful people. When I thought my husband was MIA Pascale was right there with me ready to wage war in finding him until Manual gently stuck his head around the corner and said, " I just looked at the ticket...he arrives tomorrow". Maps, advice, it is all there. A bit noisy at times but if you get in late enough at night, and you will, you will fall back asleep. I can't say enough. It felt like home away from home. Manual, hope you got feeling better quick. I was deathly sick myself the night before we left. Tom talked me into some gravol which is a good idea if you don't have do anything like pack and catch a flight! Highly recommend the hotel and everyone there.

Reviews.Title: “'5' star service for a '3-star' hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Sg T
Reviews.Content: This review is slightly late as I just returned from a week's stay in Amsterdam as I was therefore a major event last week at Amsterdam RAI. I had wanted to spend a few days before the event so stayed for 2-nites from 01-03Oct ... what can I say about this hotel...nothing but praises for most part. Firstly I arrived very early, took the Connexion bus from Schipol to hotel vicinity [which Manuel was kind enough to advise me:] Obviously I stopped at the depot instead of the bus stop in front of the hotel and had to walk a few minutes and not knowing the direction, I decided to call the hotel to ask for directions...Pascale, answered the call and in a very welcoming voice said she will go out onto the street and wave at my direction and upon arriving, she readily helped my with my heavy suitcase up the stairs. Apologetically she said that my room was not ready, but asked if I want coffee and even guide me to a few places.... overall, I find my stay very comfortable, very welcomed and even though its not a 5-star hotel, the service and the friendliness of the staff Pascale, Manuel and others were very helpful. I was lucky to have the single room on the ground floor at the back and it was quiet and slept well. I would admit that its not glamourous or anything but basic and clean and that is good enough for me and for that price [as hotel rooms in Amsterdam is expensive] and the location so close to Leidsplein is really a bonus ....with so many places to eat and shopping....so I highly recommend Freeland Hotel - however, if anyone who expects to have a 5-star hotel environment, go stay at Marriot...I would say that this is like a 'Marriot' amongst the 3-stars [better than some other 3-star hotels nearby].... so you pay what you get and remember if you are not going to stay at the hotel the whole day and dont want to spend too much $$ - then Freeland is just the place for you....and last but not least, its really like a home away from home. Bonus: Free wifi throughout the hotel :) which is helpful for people who needs to check emails or surf the net :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean and quite; worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: Mimierod
Reviews.Content: If this place is available, take it. Decor a bit dated but maintenance is ok, staff are very helpful and you will get a good, private sleep. Breakfast good, WiFi good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: thematrixhasyou
Reviews.Content: Fortunately my family was not with me because they would have refused to stay here. I'm in my room at the Freeland Hotel right this minute. As I sit, the lamp is shaking due to people stomping around upstairs. There's little noise insulation. You can hear the water splash when your neighbor urinates. Staying by myself, I can tolerate the noise somewhat. I bought earplugs. My room on the 2nd floor is clean but small and in need of updating. Old, industrial carpet and TILE half way up the wall make it an interesting decor. I for sure would not have stayed here except that I felt it was clean...and the excellent location right by the Leidseplein. Would I stay here again? Maybe only by myself, but for sure not with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Rooms! Rude Owner! Rip Off! Book Elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Simone091
Reviews.Content: Freelandâ€™s website states that their hotel is clean and friendly â€“ donâ€™t believe it! When I arrived I had to wait nearly two hours for my room during which the Owner left and did not provide apologies or explanation. Once I made it inside the room I was horrified! Everything was filthy from the ceiling to the floor. Dust covered the wall dÃ©cor, the carpet was old, dirty and stained; even the walls were filthy. To make matters worse, there was a strange cream colored fluid left on the pillow case. They hadnâ€™t changed the linen. The bathroom was dirty and the shower rod was being held in place by duct tape. This room was disgusting. Did I mention the old, worn out, stained towels left on the soiled bed? They were gross as well. Needless to say I did not stay in this rat hole. I reserved at another hotel. The Owner of Freeland â€“ Rick â€“ sent me several harassing emails afterwards threatening me because I requested my money back. I have since blocked him from my account and marked him as spam. Donâ€™t stay here! You will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “The best value friendly accommodation in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: bridgeyokido
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on three separate occasions throughout June in between other travels. The position of the hotel couldn't be better, close to the entertainment and dining area of Leidseplein but far enough away that you're not in the thick of the action. All the staff were welcoming and always happy to chat about things to do in Amsterdam or just general things. My favourite room was at the back of the hotel with a lovely view over a leafy courtyard and it's own bathroom. The room I didn't like as much was on the lower floor with a shared toilet on the next level, which made it interesting negotiating the narrow steep stairs in the middle of the night! If you're a light sleeper I recommend asking for a room at the back of the hotel. Breakfast is an added bonus and was a great help for extra energy for cycling around Amsterdam! Thanks to Pascale and all your staff for a great stay/s

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geofflane
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Amsterdam. It's close to a lot of the sites without being in the middle of too much of the hoopla. We enjoyed it a lot and the continental breakfast is great. We had a top-floor, courtyard view so things were quite quiet. Standard Amsterdam caveats apply: narrow, steep stair cases, no elevators, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location / value”
Reviews.Author: 00kiksu
Reviews.Content: A small and cozy hotel right next to the Leidzeplein. Trams and busses (airport) run 50m from the front door. Service was excellent and nice, prices are affordable compared to the rest of Amsterdam. The single room was really small but had all the necessary facilities. Some traffic noise from the street but its not that disturbing. Over all an excellent little hotel definitely worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: emf790
Reviews.Content: Despite the unusually small room (typical for Amsterdam), this place was in the best location I could have found. It is right near the Leidesplein, with many restaurants and lots of shopping. It is also walking distance (a good walk though) from Ann Frank House, the Vondelpark and all the museums. I only took the tram to get to the train station/airport. The staff was very helpful--they gave me restaurant recommendations, directions and other info, and they serve a sizable breakfast. The rooms are clean and the hotel is pretty quiet, if you get a room in the back. Although the rooms ARE expensive for what they are, so is everything in Amsterdam. Way better to stay in this location than near the train station! One last thing--please ignore all the people who complain about the steep staircases in Amsterdam. If you know anything about the history of the city, you will know that this is just simply how things ARE. It should not dissuade you from staying anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “best location, helpful and friendly staff, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: missjackson99
Reviews.Content: i came up to amsterdam for my birthday, just by myself. i had a wonderful time and part of it was due to the location of this hotel. it is right in liedseplein, which is the party area of amsterdam. the hotel is actually located RIGHT ACROSS the street from an amazing club, milkweg. and when you sleep you dont even hear the noise outside. the breakfast was typical dutch style, hard bolied egg, lots of toast, jam, ham, cheese, orange juice and coffee. the dudes who work there were super nice. one was french i think, the other dutch, and the other american, and they also speak tons of other languages. i did have one problem, i left two hats there and by the time they got back to me the maid had thrown it away. but i wont hold it against them, because i left it there. and they were really sympathetic about it too,. the staff also directed me on where to go in the city, like what bus to take and stuff, called me a cab when i went back to the airport, and so i gave them the rest of my stash. it was truly an AMAZING trip. i got exactly what i paid for and more. location location location. i recommend this place and will stay there next time i come to the dam.LOVE.and i send blessings to the people who work there :) oh and free wifi all the time. just bring your laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel but home...”
Reviews.Author: muratlovesnewyork
Reviews.Content: What an exceptional location together with an exceptional atmosphere to have been created by both the wonderful owners Pascale and Rick and the other staff working there.In the very way the concept HOME is differentiated from the "house".I can not possibly name this place a hotel due to the exceptional atmosphere reflecting the very spirit of the human being... And on top of everything the location is exceptional being in the heart of it all... Thanks for all the falks who had and still are creating such a wonderful setting for all the travelers...

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: thatgirl888
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in October of 2007 for the beginning of our honeymoon. The owners are fantastic, the location is great! Our rooms were small, but comfy, decorated with tulip themed decor. The beds were exceptionally comfortable. There is also a little vending machine in the downstairs area that vends Heinekin! The hotel is within walking distance to the museums, coffeeshops, bars, restaurants, etc. If you want to get farther, the tram system will take you. It is also right around the corner from the casino. We are visiting Amsterdam again in a few weeks, so we wanted to book here again. However, the prices for staying during New Year's were out of our price range, so we opted for another accommodation this time.

Reviews.Title: “It is not a hotel. It is my home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: nkelaiditis
Reviews.Content: Very few words. As a travel agent, I can stay in whichever hotel I want at a discounted rate. Last year (Nov 2009) by accident I stay in this hotel. It was the best experience I had. This year I will go again. And the year after and so on. Pascale is my "sister" in Amsterdam. I strongly recommend this hotel, for those that want to feel the breeze of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: SC070
Reviews.Content: Hotel Freeland is located in the entertainment area of Amsterdam - many bars, clubs, and cafes. If I had known beforehand, I wouldn't have booked. Too much chaos in terms of the location. The hotel itself is old and the rooms are bare bones, no frills. We stayed there two nights, and they weren't cleaned the second night. Breakfast was just okay - juice, coffee or tea, toast/break, a few sliced meats, an egg. The lady receptionist is super friendly though and would go out of her way to help you out. They had free internet from a computer that you can use - so that was a bonus. Overall, it was a bit overpriced for what it is. Party people types may like it though.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlieder
Reviews.Content: We (my daughter and I) chose this hotel based on guidebooks recommendations. We didn't expect luxury, but for 120 Euros/night we did expect a certain level of comfort and service. We requested a room with twin beds. We were given a room on the 3rd floor with a double bed that just about filled the small room. Bathroom was tiny with no real shower "stall," which meant a flooded, slippery floor everytime we showered. Room had been recently painted & plastered and the smell of both was overwhelming and sickening. Worst still, a building a few doors away was also being painted, and there was no escape from the smell. A single bed was brought in later that week. Eventually we were moved to a ground floor room (with a double bed!) and an even funkier bathroom/shower arrangement. Toilet seat was broken off the toilet. This room did have a "veranda" and view of the hotel garden. Breakfast was in the basement and was all right.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great bargain for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JimBeau-n-TX
Reviews.Content: Look forward to returning to Amsterdam again and staying at the Freeland. During my visit to Amsterdam, I injured my foot, which required a trip to the hospital. The hotel staff was wonderful, accompanying me to the emergency room and ensuring that I was able to navigate the Dutch medical system (which was superb I might add). Beyond that, the Freeland is convenient, just a block or so from the Leidesplein tram, which will connect you to everything. Breakfast was delicious, with plenty to tide you over until a late lunch or early dinner. I was in Room #8, with a big window that faced out on to Marnixstraat. Loved opening it and getting the nice breeze in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely come back if I visit Amsterdam again”
Reviews.Author: McDull_2468
Reviews.Content: I paid 68 euro per night and I've stayed for 5 nights in Room 7. (just read the previous review, how come it's 40 euro for the same room???...mystery) It's not cheap to me, but comparing to those single room in hostel sharing a bathroom which could cost you more than 80 euro, this single ensuite is good for value. The room is clean. Bedsheets are clean. Towels should be clean but looked like a bit yellowish, probably it's time to buy some new one. Handy kettle and a bed side lamp, all you need for internet surfing with complimentary wi-fi at night. Breakfast is simple but great and plenty. Good service and staff are polite. Once I arrive the receptionist gave me a free map (you know the tourist information point at the Schiphol Airport is selling it for 2 euro!!!!). I was lucky to have room 7 coz it was the 1st room on the 1st floor. I was even luckier as the receptionist has helped me to take my 24kg-suitcase up to the scarily steep staircase. The second day of my trip I felt tired at the morning and I hanged the little "do not disturb" sign at the door. Then they didn't clean my room. At the evening I found that I was running out of toilet paper and towel, I ran to the reception to get some, the receptionist immediately gave me new towel and toilet paper and said sorry about that, while actually it's ME hanging that sign on the door. The location is superb. A few step next to Leisplein. You can take bus no. 197 to Leisplein and then walk to the hotel in 2 minutes. It's much easier and cheaper than taking the train to Amsterdam Central Station then tram no. 1/2/5. There are shops and fast food restaurants opened til midnight. The only thing that can be improved is that, the heat doesn't work quite well. The hot water was dripping inside the heater for the whole night, and it's not very warm. Others are perfect for a cheap single ensuite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful return visit!”
Reviews.Author: damsqu
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to congratulate the Hotel Freeland on making my stay such a wonderful experience, once again! I have reviewed this hotel once before a few years ago, and was delighted that their single room came up as one of the cheapest in Amsterdam for my latest stay. I bagged the room for under 40 euros a night. The room itself was lovely, number 7. It has its own little entrance hall, opening into a good sized single with high ceilings and huge fully opening windows (room overlooked the back gardens). Interesting to note the ashtrays in the rooms, although it is a non smoking hotel. You gotta love Amsterdam! Room was very clean but a bit tired around the edges and probably due a lick of fresh paint soon. TV worked fine and the shower room though small was perfectly adequate. Tea and coffee facilities on each floor is a nice touch. Fantastic location, just off the Leidseplein means you are close to all the action and herds of trams to choose from, to take you city wide. But its the service and warm welcome you receive at Hotel Freeland that is worth its weight in gold! Well done and thank you!

Reviews.Title: “My type of travel accomodation : simple, clean and comfortable with a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugnut
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at Hotel Freeland. Perfect location, a few steps from bus 197 stop at Leidseplein from the airport. Wonderful friendly staff and I truly enjoyed the simple, clean and comfortable accomodation. I certainly would stay again. The kind of little place with interesting decorative touches that I enjoy. Breakfast and internet make it an incredible value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here was fun”
Reviews.Author: girlovestogo
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for its price and location, and was pleasantly surprised with the entire experience. Requested a room on the top floor up the skinny, steep stairs. There's a handrail, so it was doable, and the reward was a tiny, cheerful, cozy room with a great view of the canal and street below. The bed sat right next to the large windows that not only let in delightful sunshine, but it also opened for fresh air and allowed me to enjoy the sounds of the street below. (Ear plugs recommended.) I've never seen a small space more smartly organized with cubbie holes, shelves, and hooks for storage. TV worked, bathroom was efficient, everything was very clean. One free internet station in lobby was often available and worked well. Really appreciated the tea and instant coffee, but mostly appreciated the cold Heineken in the vending machine downstairs. Staff was always helpful with train schedules and directions. The Freeland was just right for me and helped make my stay a memorable one. Will definitely return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place, spacious room, good value if a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Gamemaker
Reviews.Content: I depend on Tripadvisor reviews for bargain hunting, and the other reviews I saw were pretty accurate. I liked this hotel - the staff were very friendly, and they let me check in early after waiting a bit for my room to be cleaned. My room, facing the street, was surprisingly spacious for an inexpensive Amsterdam hotel, even a large bathroom with two sinks. It was clean and is in a convenient location. The only negatives I experienced were the steep and narrow stairs, a bit treacherous with my bags (although they offered to help me carry them up), and the fairly noisy bars right across the street. I was there in November and slept fine with the windows closed, if I'd been there in July with the windows open the noise would have been a bit of a problem. But overall I found it a good bargain and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: djbcamb
Reviews.Content: Yes, the stairs are steep and there is no lift, so it's not the hotel if you are in any way infirm. However, many buildings in Amsterdam have the same design, so it's worth checking beforehand wherever you book. I enjoyed staying at this hotel; the room was fine (a kettle and tea and coffee-making facilities in the room was a welcome bonus; almost unheard of away from Britain) and an electric fan provided as standard. This was a good touch as our room faced the street and the traffic noise is somewhat pervasive so you wouldn't want to leave the window open at night. In fact, my top tip is always to take a set of cheap earplugs, bought from any pharmacy, with you wherever you go; they cost very little and they are well worth it. Then any traffic/bar/other noise is no problem. The other thing about this hotel is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff; absolutely first rate. I'd recommend it (and you can catch the Interliner 370 bus from the airport, which stops just 2 minutes away on Liedesplain) but with the proviso about the stairs, and do bear in mind it does not face a canal.

Reviews.Title: “The Stairs Are Crazy!”
Reviews.Author: FreedomButterfly
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here for one night via the website and I was really pleased with the friendly communication from them. The hotel is easy enough to find and was in a perfect location for where I wanted. Sadly I decided not to stay there when I arrived. I was allocated the room on the top floor in what I can only describe the attic with four flights of stairs which were neither suitable for me or for the person I was travelling with. There was no chance I could have got my suitcase up one flight of the steep step ladder type stairs let alone four. I did attempt to carry up what I needed leaving my case downstairs but after managing three flights I decided it was not going to be suitable and choose to leave. I paid the 100 Euros agreed for the room and left, I checked into a chain hotel not far away for a night which surprisingly wasnâ€™t much more expensive than this one! The downside, they really need to add on their website about the location of the rooms and warn people of the stairs and how steep they are. Iâ€™d like to add a friend did stay there the following night and she describe her stay as an experience to remember! Personally I am use to hotel so I would avoid staying somewhere like this, it was a last minute trip to Amsterdam as part of a European tour so I didnâ€™t really have much chance to check out places and read reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: travelomania08
Reviews.Content: I liked the hospitality of the hotel staff very much. It is very conveniently-located. The hotel is situated in a walkable proximity from the tram station. In the evenings, the square is full with activities of local artisans and people taking their time off for a drink. The hotel staff was quite co-operative and helpful. The rooms were small but cozy and were kept quite neat and tidy. The breakfast is complementary with the room charges. The only difficulty was the narrow and steep staircase, which scares someone with luggage of falling down :) Otherwise, a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “On the spot”
Reviews.Author: giedre-sa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a few days while trippin' and doing the bussines in the city. The hotel itself is small and cozy so if you're looking for something exclusive and trendy - pick another place. The people at the desk is friendly and helpful. When needed to get some adresses and directions - they pointed me them out. The hotel is really easy to find and it's maybe 25min of light wolk from central station. You can enjoy the Amsterdam on your way to and from the airport (if got light laguage). As it's next to Leidsplein so you have louds of atractions next to the door or in a short walking distance. The rooms are small and cozy. Can't say anything about the steep stairs as got the same at home so no worries for me even it was 3am. Sadly that BBC wasn't always included on TV (dunno why) so had to choose between CNN, MTV and TMF what wasn't so bad though. Sadly there's something beeing builded next to the hotel so the noise in the morning is a bit annoying but not so bad. Bathroom small but spaceiuos enough to be in. The breakfast room downstairs is really cozy and the breakfast itself are nice. Or if you want to eat in the city - you can always do that! Even the hotel was fully booked but rarely could hear your 'neighbours' unless they been climbing the stairs too noisy. In general - small and cozy hotel for those who's looking for a nice stay without problems

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nikki19_84
Reviews.Content: I booked this place because the hotel I normally stay in was getting a bit to expensive, so with that I mind I was expecting trhis place to be a down grade. I was very pleasantly surprised. On this trip I was travelling solo and received a warm welcome at the hotel. My room was basic but very clean, and that's the most important thing to me. The only downside was that my room faced the street and the bar across the road got quite noisey at night. On my second night I decided that if you can't beat em you might as well join em - and I went across the road, met some travellers and had a really good laugh. The location is great, close to Leidesplein, which is my favourite place to stay in Amsterdam. Good breakfast also included in the price which is the best way to start off a busy day in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Tubby18
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Freeland. We were returning to Amsterdam with my parents and there was no where else I would stay in Amsterdam than with the gang at the Hotel Freeland. The rooms are spacious and clean. The breakfast is excellent and fills you up so you are good to go until the late afternoon. The location cannot be beat. It is down the street from the Leidesplein, where there are outdoor cafes/ bars and a metro stop. However, you do not hear any of the noise at the hotel. There is free internet downstairs in the lobby. Are the steps steep, yes, but this is Amsterdam, they are all this way. Take it slow and by the third time doing it, you will be a pro. What makes this hotel especially stand out, is the staff. The staff are always friendly and helpful. Aside from the very very late night/early morning hours, the front desk is always open and there is always someone there to help or to simply provide a warm greeting. There is also coffee and tea and tables set up in the front room and outside. The owners are beyond compare. Having traveled in the US and abroad and stayed at many hotels both extravagant and modest, I have never encountered customer service like the Freeland. We were trying to book four train tickets to Paris (our next stop)and there was a special internet rate (1/2 off tickets) that we were unable to book while in the US because you needed a Dutch billing address. We explained the situation to the fantastic owners Rick and Pascale over email and asked if they had any ideas to help us out. Without our even asking, they purchased our tickets for us and when we offered to wire the money to them, they refused and said to simply wait until we get there. Even when we got there, they said no problem wait until we check out. It was an absoiute pleasure to stay there and I would highly recommend it, for the location, the cleaniess and spaciousness of the rooms, and most of all the people.

Reviews.Title: “5* for staff service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Dorith
Reviews.Content: I have travelled since I was 17 and gave myself this trip as my 60th birthday gift. I have stayed in the cheapest places in many corners of the world and in 5* hotels but NEVER experienced such hospitality, service and friendlines such as the staff of Freeland. I was welcomed with a birthday greeting and a gift ! There was always time for a smile, a cup of coffee and a chat. I was supposed to check out at 10.30 a.m. but had mixed up the date of my departure ! Returned early evening from the city and realised that I had to leave for my plane in 30 minutes ! Since a new visitor had come to check in, the staff had stored all my luggage in the kitchen and looked after it the whole day. They just told me to relax, have a coffee and were extremely nice and phoned for a taxi to take me to the airport - and they did not even charge me extra for anything which of course they had been fully entitled to. I can certainly recommend this hotel to anybody. It may be rated 2* but the staff deserves a proper 5* !!! DonÂ´t hesitate, you will never regret to book this hotel ! Dorith, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Freeland Hotel Exceeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: DRogers08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Freeland for two weeks during April 2008. The Freeland Hotel is special mostly because of the helpful, friendly, and warm staff and owners. The Freelandâ€™s quiet and exceptional location is a fantastic bonus, as is the Freelandâ€™s consistent cleanliness. For the price, the Freeland is worth every cent! The breakfast is excellent. And the helpfulness and knowledge of Amsterdam â€“ whether shopping or viewing the arts â€“ by the multilingual staff is top notch. Thank you Barbara, Pascale, and Rick for helping make my Amsterdam visit very, very special!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Snickerbilly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel Freeland March 22nd - 25th. It was very easy to find from the tram stop at Leidseplein. Let me say that the stairs are very steep. Our first two nights we were on the very top floor and after becoming winded going up the stairs numerous times we asked and they put us in a room on the second floor. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful and answered all of our questions and gave us recommendations on things to do in the area. The location is great, a short walk from restaurants, pubs and numerous coffeeshops (CS Crush is across the street). The breakfast was good and they will make you a cup of coffee anytime you wish. They also have free internet access which was useful for checking e-mails and keeping in touch with family and friends. For a good meal I would recommend Puri Mas, which is an Indonesain Restaurant about two blocks from the hotel. For a beer I would go to Cafe de Koe which is across the street and to the left abot 100 yards. For coffeeshops there is the Crush right next door to Cafe de Koe, The Rokerij, Noon, the Dolphin, La Tertulia and several others all within a short walk from the hotel. I would definitely return but would ask for a lower level floor as the stairs are more like a ladder which is typical for buildings in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: tw816
Reviews.Content: really small room, i pay 70 euro for 1 small room like the bathroom in the us, for 2 night. owner was smoker if you don't like here is no. i am leaving next day early 4am hotel person call me say i did not pay yet, i tell them i pay first day when i arrival the hotel by cash. she call the owner and owner say she did not rememebr, and time is 10pm tell me about it. i been waitting for 20 mins for them to check. they did not have any idea i pay or not, really bad service. and room is small and no anything for you to use. would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Freeland”
Reviews.Author: jdbri
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from an enjoyable stay at the Freeland. The hotel is on a street off the Leidseplein, a lively square bustling with cafÃ©s, restaurants and shops. Several trams pass through the Leidseplein and it's a short journey to Centraal Station and the centre of the city. Although the hotel is round the corner from all the action the street it's on is relatively quiet. Perhaps the front of the hotel gets some street noise but I had a room at the rear and I heard nothing. The reception area has a couple of tables with chairs (like a little cafÃ©, perhaps) and free tea and coffee are on tap all day. There's also a selection of books, magazines and DVDs to borrow. In the hallway there's a drinks vending machine (beer, coke, etc.) and a computer with free internet access. Wi-fi codes are also available free from reception. The hotel is decorated around various flower themes and may not appeal to everyone. But clearly a lot of work and though has gone in to the dÃ©cor and everything matches and co-ordinates. I had a single room on the second floor (Room 11) and it was a 'rose' room. I've uploaded a couple of photos. Although not particularly large, the room felt spacious enough. There was a single bed, bedside table, a little chair and matching stool, one of those folding things you can put your case on and a wall cabinet with a hanging rail below. There was a TV/DVD combo, bedside light and fan. The en suite bathroom had a toilet, sink and shower. Although not particularly big, it didn't feel claustrophobic, either. Everything was very clean and the room was serviced daily. Breakfast was typically Dutch - bread and cake with jams, hams, cheeses, hard-boiled egg, orange juice and tea or coffee. All very tasty and nicely served. The staff were friendly and helpful but not over-friendly; they happily answer questions and offer advice but don't tend to ingratiate themselves - if you like your hosts to interrogate you on your previous day's adventures and your current day's plans this isn't the place for you. Like I said, they're friendly but not "in your face". Minor issues are dealt with promptly - a blown light bulb was replaced immediately and a jammed DVD player, when reported as I was leaving for the day, was repaired by the time I returned late afternoon. Previous reviewers have mentioned the cat. It's a beautiful thing and it's sometimes around. It's not in the dining room and it's not in the guest rooms - it's in the reception area if it's in. It adds to the general ambiance of the hotel and gives a feeling of a place lived in, not just used to bed down in for a few nights. I liked The Freeland and I hope you do, too.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: josephboots
Reviews.Content: arrived at approximately 1030hrs----a room was ready(a relief after 7 hour flight)---wife and i spent six days in this hotel---no complaints---staff was more than helpful--free internet to check messages a plus---beds were quite comfortable-----Dutch breakfast was good---will stay there again and recommend this to anyone ---- great location-----completely satisfied---thank you Freeland

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: hang
Reviews.Content: At first, I was apprehensive of climbing all of the Dutch style stairs. The hotel is for the physically fit, especially of your room is on one of the upper floors. We had a very large twin room. It was large by even "big name" hotels. THe matrasses were great. THe room was spotless. The continental breakfast was ample. While there is street construction, it did not bother us. We left the hotel by 9 AM and returned after 9 PM. All of the staff was very helpful. I suggest the hotel to the your crowd for the above reason. THe staff was always helpful, offering us coffee and being just pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Just Loved IT !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marycya21
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends stayed there for 4 night, and it was great experience for us. The hotel is clean and close to Everything, the rooms are medium size not small,free internet service. The breakfast was cool also. The stairs are steep but it's OK :) . Pascale and Rick are wonderfull people. Freeland was all that we were looking for . Very good value for the money, i would definitely stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Not for us”
Reviews.Author: Lpmch
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a three night stay but initial impressions were enough to tell us that it wasn't for us. The cat sitting on the table may be cute to some people but it doesn't appeal to me. The room overlooked an unkempt overgrown area at the back. The room and whole hotel looks very shabby and extremely basically furnished. The main thing that put us off was the musty smell as soon as we entered the room, and the deeply soiled carpets. The room had been cleaned and linen etc looked clean but it is way past needing a change of carpet, washed net curtains and a few Euro spent on furnishing. It may suit if you are loooking for a very basic place to get your head down. Personally I would't recommmend it. We picked up our suitcases, paid for one night and left immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jbeebe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Freeland Hotel in September 2007 and had a great time in Amsterdam. The hotel is very conveniently situated near the Leidseplein and its easy tram connections to other areas of the city. The staff were very helpful both before the trip and during our stay. As with most hotels in Amsterdam, the staircase is very narrow and steep, which might understandably be problematic for some. My only complaint, which isn't with the hotel itself, was that there was a large construction project underway just down the block, which meant that there were loud noises from the site starting early, usually around 7:30 AM every day. Otherwise, the hotel was absolutely fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: JaDo24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Freeland Hotel in September. Priced well below others the Freeland offers guests an excellent location and super friendly staff. The room is very basic - but clean (will take this over a posh but dirty space any day). Free internet service. Good breakfast each morning. Rick and team were just great. They have earned their good reputation and I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld25
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for 3 nights in May 2007. We were looking for a budget hotel, and Amsterdam turned out to be quite a pricey city. From research I came across the Freeland Hotel which seemed to have good reviews, so booked it. For the price, it was good value. Its not a posh modern hotel, but then we didn't expect it to be. Yes, it has narrow stairs but so do a lot of hotels in Amsterdam. The room was clean and basic, it had a small balcony with a view of the canal, the bathroom could have done with a bit of DIY and the bed was not that comfortable. The staff were friendly. The location was excellent - walkable to plenty of shops, restaurants, bars. Near a tram stop and also near one of the stops for the hop on hop off canal boat. The breakfast was adequate and was enough to set you up for the day - tea/coffee, toast, boiled egg, ham. This is a good choice if you are looking for a reasonably priced option and are not expecting the ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, pity about the stairs.”
Reviews.Author: Roger-in-Peacehaven
Reviews.Content: I had a week or so's holiday due to me from the part time job which I do in our local supermarket in June 2007(my Easyjet money as I call it!), and as I had never been to Amsterdam before, I considered that the city would be a interesting place to visit for a short break. Upon researching the internet beforehand, I was disappointed to find that Amsterdam is quite an expensive city in which to stay, and being a budget traveller, I had to spend much time trying to find accommodation at a price which I could afford, but which on the other hand was not too grotty. At this point in time I must make it clear that without being a prude I was not interested in 'Red Light' districts, weed or space cakes because at the age of 64 I am really past all this old nonsense!! - in fact in my time no doubt I've tried it all anyway! My only requirement regarding my hotel was that it needed to be cheap,clean and safe,offering a good breakfast, and easily accessible to the city centre too. Getting to and from Amsterdam from where I live in Peacehaven in East Sussex was no problem, and I managed to do this cheaply by booking seperate return coach tickets over the internet on the National Express(Brighton-London, Funfare Â£4 return) and Eurolines coaches(London-Amsterdam; Netherlands special Â£37 return fare)which as you can see only cost me Â£41 in total from Brighton to Amsterdam and back. At these prices I just had to go! - even the cheapest return Easyjet flight from Gatwick to Amsterdam at the time of booking would had cost me Â£55, and I would had to additionally buy a return coach ticket from my home to Gatwick Airport to get to and from the airport. and I must say that I do consider that the extra airport taxes imposed by our wonderful(?) british government in February 2007 are absolute greed to say the least,(whatever blurb they may give you about global warming to try to justify this extra taxation !) and I do feel extremely sorry for the budget airlines such as Easyjet who do such an excellent job, and with whom I've have previously had many satisfactory flights, but who potentially stand to lose many passengers as a result of these extra taxes, as people such as myself on limited incomes have no option other than to seek out the cheapest fares, which in this particular instance turned out to be by coach. In any event part of the fun of going away is finding yourself a 'cheapo' fare! I would add also that upon arrival in Amsterdam the coach terminates at Amstel Station, which is very conveniently placed about a couple of miles or so away from the city centre, and from which point it is cheaper to gain access to the city than from Schiphol Airport ever would had been - in fact I walked it! The only downside to the coach trip was that it was an eleven hour through journey each way between London and Amsterdam,and as a point of interest my outward journey was made via the Dover-Calais channel crossing, and the return trip was through the Channel Tunnel, and I must add that the 'Eurolines' direct coach service between London and Amsterdam whilst hardly of five star quality was in fact quite an acceptable and convenient service. My chosen hotel was the Hotel Freeland, 386 Marnixstraat, Amsterdam which in the event turned out to be very conveniently situated for the Leidseplein which was around five hundred yards away at the most, and this is a popular tourist area with many restaurants, bars and shops and it is located fairly near to the city centre which is within walking distance if you so wish, and there are excellent tram links to the city taking around ten minutes or so. I booked the Hotel Freeland directly over the internet beforehand,([--]) and my single room cost me â‚¬65 per night which I considered to be expensive compared to hotels in other european cities in which I had stayed previously, but in fairness to the Hotel Freeland this price seemed consistant with the current Amsterdam prices allowing for the fact that this hotel was so centrally situated, and I noted that many other Amsterdam hotels seemed to be charging up to double this amount, and according to internet reviews which I had perused beforehand I had noticed that whilst there were cheaper hotels available, none of them had particularily brilliant reviews from their guests and it seemed to be that they were either infested with mice or fleas, which prompted my decision to stay at the Hotel Freeland where previous guests' reviews were quite favourable. Upon my arrival at the Hotel Friendland I was immediately made welcome by an extremely pleasant lady called Barbara who seemed to do everything from man the reception desk to serve the breakfasts each morning. However, the hotel presented me with a problem straightaway insomuch that my room(a single room,No.12)was located on the third floor of the building, and as I've already mentioned I am in my sixties (I also have a back problem which cost me a year off work just over two years ago) and I did find it extremely difficult to take my suitcase up to the third floor of the building as the staircase was extremely steep, certainly nothing like any staircase that I had ever seen before in England before. However I am told that this is quite normal for dutch buildings, and whilst I do not wish to appear negative, I must mention that it was still very difficult for me to negotiate the stairs even without any luggage during the course of my stay, and so I would suggest that if you do consider staying at this hotel I would recommend that you agree beforehand when making your booking that you ensure that your reservation is for a room located on the ground or on one of the lower floors should you have difficulties climbing steep staircases - otherwise you may well live to regret it! I do feel that in view of all the foreign visitors who visit Amsterdam and probably this hotel, that perhaps the management could well use this situation to its' advantage and point out to potential guests that this is an authentic and beautiful dutch building in which they wish to stay, but through necessity it does however retain many of its' original features including the steep staircases, and guests who for any reason feel uncomfortable about climbing steep staircases are recommended to reserve rooms on the lower floors - This would be a good public relations exercise for the hotel I feel, and it would not draw unneeded attention to a negative aspect of the building by potential guests.. I was a little disappointed with my room(bearing in mind that it had cost me Â£45 per night) - it was very small - and the private loo/shower smelt, and it seemed to me that the extractor fan located above the shower head was not functioning. However on a more positive note, the bed was comfortable, a couple of cushions, an extra blanket and spare loo roll were provided also, and there was constant hot water too, and I found that the whole hotel including my room was kept clean and tidy - so it wasn't all bad news I am pleased to say. A bedside lamp and a fan were provided in the room, and there was also a television set with nine channels in the room seated on top of a fitted cupboard, but this was so high up due to the lack of room space that watching television was uncomfortable and neck ache was envitable should you had wished to watch television for any length of time. My room had a pleasant view overlooking the road and a canal, and there were two bars on the opposite side of the road to the hotel which didn't close until 3am, but luckily they were not too noisy; however, you could be woken in the middle of the night when they closed at 3am, but the efficient double glazing in my bedroom did eliminate the street noise when the bedroom window was closed - but then in June I did need to open the window a little otherwise my room would had become too stuffy! Should you be a young person and want a night life finishing at 3am - I think that you would be very well suited here - and my comments really do prove that we are all individuals who have differing needs and priorities when booking hotel rooms - but for me, no thanks! ... ... ... ... whilst I enjoy a drink, I still need my beauty sleep!! Breakfast was served from 8am to 10.30am, and comprised of three varied slices of bread served with cheese and sliced meats. A toaster was provided for guests to toast their bread slices, and butter, jam and peanut butter was provided also. Tea and coffee was supplied, although the tea cups provided were very small - next time I'll bring my mug from home! A boiled egg in an eggcup also was provided - but every morning the egg was hard boiled, which rather spoilt the otherwise reasonable breakfast provided by the hotel - perhaps egg timers haven't been invented yet in Amsterdam! I stayed for four nights at the Hotel Freeland, and everybody with whom I came into contact with was courteous, polite and helpful....especially Barbara the member of staff who really couldn't do enough for you. A public telephone, a Coca-Cola vending machine(â‚¬1 for a can of coke)which was handy, and most usefully free internet access was provided in the hotel lobby so that one could keep up with their e/mails. Basically I came away fairly satisfied - the hotel is extremely conveniently situated and it is clean and warm. However as I departed I took one last look back at the Hotel Freeland, and I said to myself, "thank goodness I won't ever have to climb those stairs again!" Summing up I feel that the Hotel Freeland is reasonable value for money at today's Amsterdam prices, but I do consider that it is really a hotel better suited for younger people - not for old codgers in their sixties like myself suffering with bad backs and the like, although had I known about the steep staircases and requested a ground floor room when I booked my room it may well had been a different story - but then its' so easy to be wise after the event!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: FatChris
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a friend and myself, when we turned up we had been allocated a double bed rather than a twin bed. The hotel was full so the owner arranged for us to stay in the building next door, this appeared to be a private residence, it was perfectly adequate and we appreciated the effort. Breakfast was the usual European fare of boiled eggs, meat and cheeses. Location was good just near Leidseplein and Amsterdam is so small you could walk anywhere in 30 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Two seniors very well pleased”
Reviews.Author: KathMargie
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic three day break at the Freeland Hotel. We shared a twin bedded room on the 2nd floor with a balcony complete with flag! Stairs, although plentiful, were not a problem and we accepted them as a true characteristic of Dutch houses. Owners and Staff were extremely friendly, helpful and had a terrific sense of humour. The location was excellent and we enjoyed many wonderful sights, including a trip to the Keukenhof Gardens arranged by hotel staff. A break from walking was to board the hop on/hop off canal boats from which to take in the ambience of the city. Well worth another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: kelly290879
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night break staying at this hotel. There was 4 of us all together(2 sets of couples). We have stayed at other hotels in Amsterdam, but this is what we thought of this: The hotel is great value for money, location is excellent, with the majority of places being within walking distance (museums, dam square, red light district, shops, markets, bars and clubs), if you do want to venture further afield then the trams provide an excellent service. This is typical dutch building, tall and narrow, and because of this has plenty of stairs!!! If you have problems walking I would suggest contacting the hotel to request a ground floor, the breakfast is served in the basement so there would still be the stairs to go down there but at least you would not have to climb to go to your room. Rooms are clean and tidy and ours both had en-suites which were basic shower rooms, again these were clean and tidy, clean towels are provided and any dirty ones you leave on the floor will be replaced daily as the rooms are cleaned and beds made. The staff are very friendly and are on hand to provide help with anything you need to know about Amsterdam. Overall: Great hotel, great location, friendly staff, clean & tidy and all for a reasonable price. Dont go expecting the Ritz or Hilton, be realistic. This hoel provides everything you need. We will definatly be visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hell!”
Reviews.Author: drzennomad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last fall after seeing reviews online. We were very excited to give it a try after emails with the owners. It was the worst hotel we have stayed at in Amsterdam! The room was shabby and not well-tended. One day, we left early for a day trip and returned home to find the room not made up and the towels were not changed. The surly evening desk clerk initially refused to give us fresh towels and said it was our fault as we obviously did not let the room cleaners in the room. From that point on, it was very uncomfortable with one of the owners. For the money they charge, one would think that one would receive better value/service for the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Freeland Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Marnixstraat 386, Amsterdam 1017 PL, The Netherlands
